results.title: Controlling stocks
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Management Techniques”.
One of a series of films about some of the problems of forecasting, and of trying to achieve control through forecasts, particularly in the case of small and medium-sized firms. Carrying excessive stocks can be expensive, whilst insufficient stocks may cause loss of customer confidence. Shows how to strike a reasonable balance of stock holdings.

results.title: Controlling quality is everybody's business
results.creator_credit: Wallace J. Richardson and Industrial Education Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a sound working knowledge of the principles of effective quality control, and how these may be applied. The film also dramatises the importance of maintaining good quality, and shows how everyone can help.

results.title: Controlling exposure
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Designed to help students become more aware of the qualities and effects of available light. Jack Welpott shows various indoor and outdoor settings and describes the way he responds to specific lighting conditions. Explores the emotional and aesthetic effects of light together with the technical aspects.

results.title: Controlling behavior through reinforcement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Schedules of conditioning thorugh reinforcement are illustrated with pigeons in Skinner apparatus and their applications to human behaviour are indicated. Demonstrates the effects of: (1) fixed rate reinforcement which results in a high work output; (2) variable intervals resulting in the falling off of output; (3) variable interval reinforcement which causes continuous output at a high rate and persists after reinforcement discontinues.

results.title: Controlling absenteeism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Supervisor Series”.
Focuses on the causes of absenteeism in business and offers practical solutions. Identifies five categories of absentees and provides supervisors with coping strategies and tactics to avoid in dealing with staff.

results.brief_description: Demonstrates the three basic considerations in controlled photographic lighting: placement of lights, quality of light and lighting ratio. Shows the functions of main, fill, background and accent lights.

results.title: Controlled heat
results.creator_credit: Jack Chambers, Douglas Clarke and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: By means of diagrams and photography tells the story of thermostatic control. Shows, in fact, how the expansion of metals when heated can be used to regulate temperatures. The story is treated historically, beginning in the 18th century with the problem of accurate time-keeping, especially for navigation, and leading up to such complicated modern examples as open-hearth steel processing.

results.title: Controlled forces
results.brief_description: “Summary: translated from the German. original title- kontrollierte kraefte- eine dokumentation der suspa . describes suspa’s post-tensioning method whereby high tensile steel wires are installed in the building unit, and stressed with hydraulic jacks, after the concrete has hardened to impart maximum load-bearing capacity. shows the suspa factory in the rhineland and the pre- fabrication of tendons. the quality control standards (elongation tests, ultimate tensile tests, fatigue tests), are also illustrated. this bbrv method is able to be used in all branches of civil engineering”
results.description: “Summary: translated from the German. original title- kontrollierte kraefte- eine dokumentation der suspa . describes suspa’s post-tensioning method whereby high tensile steel wires are installed in the building unit, and stressed with hydraulic jacks, after the concrete has hardened to impart maximum load-bearing capacity. shows the suspa factory in the rhineland and the pre- fabrication of tendons. the quality control standards (elongation tests, ultimate tensile tests, fatigue tests), are also illustrated. this bbrv method is able to be used in all branches of civil engineering”

results.title: Control your emotions
results.brief_description: A preemptive strike against a generation of uncontrolled, emotional teenagers. “Control your emotions” is hosted by an unnamed expert wearing a white lab coat. He sits behind a desk while moving around blocks labeled RAGE, FEAR and LOVE and a big cardboard disk titled PERSONALITY. He also repeatedly interrupts the story of Jeff Moore, the film’s protagonist, with psychobabble such as, “Your emotions can be your own greatest enemy,” and “Severe emotional stress often decreases efficiency.” Jeff, who has dark circles under his eyes, supposedly has a hard time controlling his emotions. But the only examples shown are of him losing his temper. But by the end of the film Jeff has learned that he’s happiest when reason triumphs over feeling, and he joins the gang at a marshmallow roast.
